gunjeet sandhu wrote:

> Hi All,
> 
> I have been assigned a task to create UNIT test Cases
> for a strutsbased application.
> 
> So i used StrutsTestCase to do so. But my problem is
> doing so i can not do white box testing.

Why not? You don't know how? You are not able to? The design does not 
make white box testing easy?

> My Team Lead
> wants me to check the functionality of each method
> also.

Good idea, although it is better to test behavior (user transactions), 
rather that methods. Maybe you don't need all those methods.

> Can somebody help me out in this.

The bad news is that I'm writing a book on the topic, so I'm not 
releasing material from it right now. The good news is that it's not 
that difficult. I recommend you simply start writing tests for *any* 
part of the application that you think you know how to test, then learn 
from your experience.

For example, test your Action classes. Verify that your Action class 
chooses the correct forward name in each different use case scenario. 
Verify that your Action class correctly invokes (or implements) business 
logic and correctly invokes your Model Objects.

Just try writing a test and see where it takes you. Bring your problems 
to the Yahoo! group called junit-cookbook so that I can include them in 
the book. :)

Good luck.
